snippet.title: Egypt draft law to widen 'terror' definition
snippet.description: Rights groups and lawyers say it would grant authorities far-reaching powers to quash dissent amid an already alarming slide toward authoritarianism.

snippet.title: AP News in Brief at 8:58 p.m. EDT
snippet.description: US, Russia trade warnings on Ukraine; Russia told it has 'days, not weeks' to abide by accord

snippet.title: Oklahoma court puts 2 executions on hold
snippet.description: A sharply divided Oklahoma Supreme Court on Monday put on hold the executions of two death row inmates who have challenged the secrecy surrounding the source of the state's lethal injection drugs.

snippet.title: Man dies after being shot at federal courthouse
snippet.description: Defendant Siale Angilau was listening to a witness describe gang initiation rituals on Monday when authorities said he grabbed a pen, rushed toward the witness and lunged at him.

snippet.title: US justices seek middle ground in Argentina case
snippet.description: The U.S. Supreme Court appeared to be searching for a middle ground Monday in the decade-long battle between Argentina and holders of its defaulted bonds.

snippet.title: The decades-old idea that could break the net neutrality logjam
snippet.description: Advocates are looking for creative legal solutions for the FCC on Internet openness.

snippet.title: In Md. court, teen takeover offers a second chance
snippet.description: The 16-year-old said he didn't think before stealing a shirt, pants, hat and jewelry box from a local Kohl's. He had fallen in with new friends after moving from Virginia to Maryland, and he followed their lead. He put on the clothes and started to walk out of the store.

snippet.title: 'An Idea Whose Time Has Come: Two Presidents, Two Parties, and the Battle for the Civil Rights Act of 1964' by Todd S. Purdum
In Egypt, a corruption watchdog hit by backlash
snippet.description: Hesham Genena has created uproar by trying to actually do his job. The head of one of Egypt's foremost government oversight agencies, he says he has uncovered billions of dollars-worth of corruption, involving some of the country's most untouchable institutions, including the police, intelligence agencies, and the judiciary.
